data.title: [ci skip]V3.13.1 doc
can't compile libcocos2dx-with-controller with "--android-studio"
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r12b (NDK in Android SDK)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create new project
2. edit <project>/proj.android-studio/settings.gradle and change the path to libcocos2dx-with-controller
3. call _compile compile -p android --android-studio_
   --> error: package com.android.vending.expansion.zipfile does not exist 

PS: A change to the proj.android works fine.

data.title: while playing music in background, preload it make this music stop.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.13
- devices test on:Samsunm I9300
- developing environments
  - NDK version:r10b
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. play the background music:

2. preload this background music:

data.title: Node::Draw not smooth on complex, wider lines
data.body:
Drawing thicker lines show sawtooth and other artifacts. Tested on win32. Haven't tested it on other platforms. See screen captures (taken from a modified cpp-test)
- Original, with no line width:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20006414/18253919/056008ca-7399-11e6-9f32-ef4681fb2df2.png)
- With line width:
  ![cardinalspline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20006414/18253837/4c5ade9a-7398-11e6-9076-aa30c6d40995.png)
- Original, with no line width:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20006414/18253929/14813d38-7399-11e6-993e-6d002003f03e.png)
- With line width:
  ![catmullrom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20006414/18253838/4e441e7e-7398-11e6-925c-3c9230f09b8b.png)
- cocos2d-x version: 3.11.1
- devices test on: win32 
- developing environments
  - NDK version: -
  - Xcode version: -
  - VS version: VS 2015 update 3 community 
  - brower type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

Edit ActionsTest.cpp
- ActionCatmullRom::onEnter()

Modify drawing parameters of both nodes adding these lines:

New Line 1997: drawNode1->setLineWidth(16);

New Line 2025: drawNode2->setLineWidth(32);
- ActionCardinalSpline::onEnter()

Modify drawing parameters of both nodes adding these lines:

New Line 2083: drawNode1->setLineWidth(40);
New Line 2103: drawNode2->setLineWidth(40);

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
outlined LabelTTF  sometimes rendered dirty with artifacts
data.body: - cocos2d-x version: 3.8 - devices test on: iPhone 6+ - developing environments - NDK version: -- - Xcode version: 7.3.1 - VS version: -- - brower type and version: -- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use Chinese Language TTF to create some LabelTTF with outline enabled. 2. Not always reproducible. I think those artifacts are used to be former characters. since our game needs to display lots of Chinese characters, these textures in atlas may be removed frequently when they are not used anymore. I also found someone had same issue in v3.2: [Click Here](http://www.cocoachina.com/bbs/read.php?tid=238214) Is this something related to texture bleeding or not cleaning carefully? I'm just guessing. Some pictures to help understand:

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Hexagonal map fails on TMXTiledMap::getTileAt
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: Windows 8.1 (win32)
- developing environments
  - NDK version: n/a
  - Xcode version: n/a
  - VS version: 2015 Community
  - brower type and version: n/1

I really like the idea that _tiles are sprites :)_ -- but I could not get it to work. The problem I found can be reproduced with the code snippet below.  You may need the provided map to reproduce the problem.  It can be downloaded from drop-box: [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/vixpjo4ulm6reez/hexamap.zip?dl=0). 

```
        auto map = TMXTiledMap::create("Map.tmx");
        auto floor = map->getLayer("Floor");
        for (auto x = 0; x < map->getMapSize().width; x++)
            for (auto y = 0; y < map->getMapSize().height; y++) {
                Vec2 p(x, y);
                auto t = floor->getTileGIDAt(p);
                cocos2d::log("tile at (%d,%d) = %d", x, y, t);
                auto sprite = floor->getTileAt(p);
            }
```

The snippet produces this output:

```
tile at (0,0) = 6
tile at (0,1) = 6
tile at (0,2) = 4
tile at (0,3) = 4
tile at (0,4) = 4
tile at (0,5) = 4
tile at (0,6) = 4
tile at (0,7) = 6
tile at (0,8) = 6
tile at (1,0) = 6
Assert failed: TMX atlas index not found. Shall not happen
Assertion failed!
```

data.title: libfmod not found when I run cpp-tests
data.body:
When I run cpp-tests I got the error `error while loading shared libraries: libfmod.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`

Configuration :
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: Linux Ubuntu 14.04 i686

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Clone the cocos repository,
2. python download-deps.py
2. git submodule update --init
2. ./install-deps-linux.sh
2. Build tests files
3. Run cpp-tests

To fix this error, I copied libfmod and lifmodL into `/usr/local/lib` folder and updated lib cache with `ldconfig`.

Suggestion : download-deps.py or install-deps-linux.sh should automatically install libfmod ?

data.title: New app crash on Android
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: virtual android x86
- developing environments
  - NDK version: 10e
  - Xcode version: n/a
  - VS version: Community 2015
  - brower type and version: n/a

Steps to Reproduce:
1. cocos new cocostest -p com.cocostest -l cpp
2. cocos run -p android --app-abi x86 -m debug
3. App starts up fine, all seems OK
4. Wait a little while (maybe 10 seconds or so), the app crashes

data.title: Scaled Sprite drop down framerate, it comes from cocos2dx 3.6(or earlier) not be fixed yet.(test in 3.10)
data.body:
Testing on IOS and Android, JSB APP
# See screenshot:

The brown background is a Sprite. It's texture is a small png file and scale to fit width of window.
**The scale more bigger the framerate is more slowly.**
**More Sprite being scaled, the framerate is more slowly**
simple code:
var landBg = new cc.Sprite("#land_bg.png");
var landBg.scaleX = 1024 / _self.landBg.width;
this.addChild(landBg);

JS: _self.landBg.scaleX :5.688889026641846
![sp1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/848803/18202923/0be48720-7146-11e6-9f5c-1d95f27490e4.png)

scaled but set visible to false:
![s2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/848803/18202921/0b25db54-7146-11e6-95e9-c804f0d8b770.png)

no scale and visible is true.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/848803/18202904/f05a4788-7145-11e6-97b6-24f41a2d0659.png)

this is the picture use to test:
![land_bg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/848803/18203092/1ad037ce-7147-11e6-9581-d2a858f5f35f.png)

data.title: JSB  special action can not work, see simple code:
data.body:
COCOS2DX 3.10 IOS 

``` javascript
toySp.runAction(
                    cc.sequence(
                        cc.delayTime(Math.random() * 2),
                        cc.sequence(
                            //  cc.spawn(
                            cc.moveTo(toyIdleDuration, toySp.x, toySp.oy + 10).easing(cc.easeSineOut()),
                            //  ),
                            // cc.spawn(
                            cc.moveTo(toyIdleDuration, toySp.x, toySp.oy).easing(cc.easeSineOut())
                            //)
                        ).repeatForever()));
```

LOG:

```
[Action update]. override me
[Action update]. override me
[Action update]. override me
[Action update]. override me
```

toySp  should move up and down, but it don't move 1 pixel.

data.title: Cocos2dx 3.12 transplanted to win10, pictures and text becomes blurred
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: NOKIA Lumia 930
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version: vs 2015
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

The same picture resource is very clear on android and iOS device, but when we transplanted the project into win10, all the pictures and text becomes blurred. I've been investigating this issue for very long time, but no results. Is there any configuration that we missed?
Now our project schedule is pending because of this issue.
Looking forward R.D team's great help. Thanks.

data.title: Fixes jsval_to_std_string could not convert number to string.
data.body: Don't use deprecated method in ActionsProgressTest.

data.title: fixed #16502: SPINE color bug (temporary storage of color was wrong in SkeletonRenderer).
v3.13 -> SPINE color bug.
data.body:
SPINE will display objects as black, when color is at all modified in the editor. Comparing color code with previous SPINE versions fixed it. Since I am not sure if this is a correct fix, I will not make a PR.

![screen shot 2016-09-02 at 08 14 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21215757/18193340/45331200-70e5-11e6-8d81-f85bbb5a2ae1.png)
